demolition

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.TextDisplay
      • demolition.Time

  • public class Time
extends TextDisplay

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double SECONDS_BETWEEN_TIME 

      • Fields inherited from class demolition.TextDisplay

        charSet, colourOne, colourThree, colourTwo, font, size, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Time(int x, int y)
      Creates a new time object at the start of the game which extends from all of the attributes and methods from the TextDisplay super class, including text(), createFont(), textFont(), textSize(), getX() and getY().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getTimeCount()
      Returns the value of the time remaining until game over
      void text(processing.core.PApplet app)
      Creates the text in the App.java to be displayed on the screen Abstract method inherited from the TextDisplay class
      void tick()
      The method used to update the frame each tick and increment the timer If the tick is called 60 times (one second), the timeCount will be updated by decreasing the value of the time remaining by 1
      void timerReset()
      Resets the timer by setting timeCount back to 180 seconds and the incrementing time back to the default of 0

      • Methods inherited from class demolition.TextDisplay

        createFont, fill, getX, getY, textFont, textSize

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • SECONDS_BETWEEN_TIME

        public static final double SECONDS_BETWEEN_TIME
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time(int x,
            int y)
        Creates a new time object at the start of the game which extends from all of the attributes and methods from the TextDisplay super class, including text(), createFont(), textFont(), textSize(), getX() and getY().
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the time object
        y - the y-coordinate of the time object
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        TextDisplay

    • Method Detail

      • text

        public void text(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Creates the text in the App.java to be displayed on the screen Abstract method inherited from the TextDisplay class
        Specified by:
        text in class TextDisplay
        Parameters:
        app - the App from which the program will run
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        TextDisplay

      • tick

        public void tick()
        The method used to update the frame each tick and increment the timer If the tick is called 60 times (one second), the timeCount will be updated by decreasing the value of the time remaining by 1

      • getTimeCount

        public int getTimeCount()
        Returns the value of the time remaining until game over
        Returns:
        the amount of time remaining

      • timerReset

        public void timerReset()
        Resets the timer by setting timeCount back to 180 seconds and the incrementing time back to the default of 0
